definitions.definition: to put something into a bag, box, etc.:
examples: We're leaving early tomorrow morning, so you'd better pack (= put clothes and other possessions into suitcases or bags) tonight.

definitions.definition: to put a material around something before putting it into a bag, box, etc. so that it will not break or be damaged:
examples: She packed the vase in tissue paper to protect it.

definitions.definition: a group, set, or collection of something:
examples: The information pack consists of a brochure and a map.

definitions.definition: a group of animals, such as dogs, that live and/or hunt together:
an organized group of children who are brownies or cubs:
examples: My uncle was the leader of my Cub pack.

definitions.definition: a group of similar people, especially one that contains people whose activities you do not approve of:
used in combination with an amount to show that that many of a particular type of goods have been wrapped and are being sold together:
